messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: hs books
messages.msgSnippet: ... www.skylarksings.com (By the way, if you can t find them locally, along with my own book, I have copies of the Wallace, Hern, and Dobson for sale -- free
messages.messageBody:
Casey Shelley wrote:

> >
> >My favorites are Nancy Wallace's Child's Work -- there is no book that I
> >know of
> >more respectful of the knowledge quests of children. Linda Dobson's Art of
> >Education -- her best book by far, but least sold, Matt Hern's "Deschooling
> >Our Lives"
>
> I'm going to check out Nancy Wallace's book, and Matt Hern's right away. I
> can't believe Linda Dobson's book The Art of Education is the least sold.
> Amazing!!
> >
> >I have a list on my website.
> >
> >david
> >
> >What is your website David?
> >
>

www.skylarksings.com

(By the way, if you can't find them locally, along with my own book, I have
copies of the Wallace, Hern, and Dobson for sale -- free shipping on all of
them, so it's cheaper than Amazon). But you can check it out at my website.
They are also available from Holt/Growing Without Schooling.)

david--

"Should now be considered the definitive work on homeschooling....an
intellectual tour de force." --Joseph Chilton Pearce. To read a sample chapter
of "And the Skylark Sings with Me", or for ordering or author tour information,
visit my website -- www.skylarksings.com -- or send an e-mail to
shantinik@...

messages.subject: Re: hs books
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m going to check out Nancy Wallace s book, and Matt Hern s right away. I can t believe Linda Dobson s book The Art of Education is the least sold.
messages.messageBody:
> From: David Albert <shantinik@...>
>Subject: Re: RE: good hs book titles; motivation; sleep help
>
>Cory and Amy Nelson wrote:
>
> > Hi Casey,
> >
> > Thanks for your suggestions about homeschooling books. My dd is only 19
> > months old, so I have plenty of time to do all of this reading :).
>
>My favorites are Nancy Wallace's Child's Work -- there is no book that I
>know of
>more respectful of the knowledge quests of children. Linda Dobson's Art of
>Education -- her best book by far, but least sold, Matt Hern's "Deschooling
>Our Lives"

I'm going to check out Nancy Wallace's book, and Matt Hern's right away. I
can't believe Linda Dobson's book The Art of Education is the least sold.
Amazing!!
>
>I have a list on my website.
>
>david
>
>What is your website David?
>
